Consular counter hours: Sunday and Thursday: 08:00 to 10:00am. You will need to make an appointment in advance for all routine notarial and documentary services.
details.access_and_opening_times:
Public holidays

Our offices will be closed for the following public holidays for 2016:

Date Offices
Sunday 3 January 2016 New Years Day
Sunday & Monday 27 & 28 March Easter
Sunday 1 May Labour Day
*Wednesday - Thursday 6 - 7 July Eid Al Fitr
*Sunday & Monday 11 & 12 September Eid Al Adha
*Monday/Tuesday 10/11 October Ashoora
*Monday 12 December Prophetâ€™s Birthday
Sunday 18 December National Day
Sunday 25 December Christmas Day
Monday 26 December Boxing Day

*Date may move by one day according to Moon sighting.

Disabled access

The Foreign & Commonwealth Office and this Embassy are keen to ensure that their buildings and services are fully accessible to disabled members of the public. Wherever possible, we have made our buildings and services accessible. Sometimes however, this is not possible due to security or other restrictions. In these situations we will endeavour to provide a service or access to a building in an alternative way to ensure equality of access for disabled people. To assist disabled visitors, we have set out below details of disabled access at this Embassy. We hope this information is helpful.

General physical access

  • Entrance to the Main Reception is clear, unobstructed and at ground level with no impediments.
  • Toilet facilities for public users can be found in Consular Section when approaching the main reception.

Contact us

If you need to visit us or use our services and feel that they may be inaccessible to you, please contact Mrs. Gaby Melvin (Tel: 17574100) who will try to find an alternative way of providing access for you.

Location and access

Information for visitors to the British Embassy

Visitors to the British Embassy Bahrain will be subject to security procedures on arrival. Visitors and their baggage/personal belongings will be subject to search. Access will be denied to any person refusing to comply with the search. Visitors are not permitted to bring in items such as mobile phones, laptops, cameras or other electrical equipment. The embassy is unable to offer a storage facilities to visitors (with the exception of mobile phones). When planning on visiting the embassy, visitors should consider leaving such items elsewhere before arrival. This is standard practice across our network of embassies.

Map

You can find British Embassy Manama on Google map.
